results.title: Red poll
results.brief_description: The Red Poll breed of cattle, which originated in East Anglia, England, is enjoying an increasing popularity throughout the world. It is a dual-purpose breed, providing milk and beef combined. The film explains to farmers the breed’s main characteristics and its advantages.
results.description: The Red Poll breed of cattle, which originated in East Anglia, England, is enjoying an increasing popularity throughout the world. It is a dual-purpose breed, providing milk and beef combined. The film explains to farmers the breed’s main characteristics and its advantages.

results.title: Red ball express
results.brief_description: To the music of “Orange Blossom Special” a train changes shape and colour. The impressionistic animation is drawn directly onto the film. Music played by Cecil Creasey.

results.title: Red and black
results.brief_description: A parody of a bull fight, effected through tricks of animation, colour and light and accompanied by lively music. No other credits available.

results.title: Recycling
results.creator_credit: Stuart Finley and Environmental Protection Agency
results.brief_description: Shows existing techniques for recovering materials from solid waste and describes the newly developed equipment and systems which may make recycling a universal project in the future. The pressure of public opinion in favour of recycling is enormous, nevertheless it is actually practised very little.
results.description: Shows existing techniques for recovering materials from solid waste and describes the newly developed equipment and systems which may make recycling a universal project in the future. results.title: Recovering from a coronary
results.creator_credit: Frank Milton, Geoffrey Scott, Ronald Bowie and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Demonstrates a practical rehabilitation program for patients with coronary heart disease (devised at Otago University Medical School and the New Zealand School of Physiotherapy) which has produced encouraging results. Although intended mainly for medical audiences, the film offers advice which would well help to avoid or delay the premature onset of coronary heart disease in the population as a whole.
